content.raw:
I see that labscript also does an 'import *'.

How are unit conversions used in practice, do experiment scripts use the unit conversion classes as imported from labscript, or do they import them explicitly from `labscript_utils.unitconversions`? If the former, then it will be difficult to modify labscript to not import * whilst being backward compatible with these scripts.
content.html:
I see that labscript also does an 'import *'.

How are unit conversions used in practice, do experiment scripts use the unit conversion classes as imported from labscript, or do they import them explicitly from labscript_utils.unitconversions? If the former, then it will be difficult to modify labscript to not import * whilst being backward compatible with these scripts.

content.raw: We \(KRb lab\) do `from labscript_utils.unitconversions import *` but it looks like the spinor lab relies on them `from labscript import *`
content.html: We (KRb lab) do from labscript_utils.unitconversions import * but it looks like the spinor lab relies on them from labscript import *

content.raw: We do not explicitly import `unitconversions` from `labscript_utils`, but have a `from labscript import *` at the beginning of all experiment scripts.
content.html: We do not explicitly import unitconversions from labscript_utils, but have a from labscript import * at the beginning of all experiment scripts.

content.raw:
Thats not correct.   
In the lab we are currently only using one unitconversion  `labscript_utils.unitconversions.apq_laser_unitconv.offset_frequency` which is imported via: 

    from labscript_utils.unitconversions.apq_laser_unitconv import *
content.html:
Thats not correct.
In the lab we are currently only using one unitconversion labscript_utils.unitconversions.apq_laser_unitconv.offset_frequency which is imported via: 

from labscript_utils.unitconversions.apq_laser_unitconv import *

content.raw:
I'll leave labscript importing * for the moment, it imports lots of time consuming things anyway like pylab, so removing the unit conversions import would only be a modest speed improvement. Maybe will break this in labscript 3.

I'll merge this, which paves the way for labscript to save fully qualified unit conversion path names, and BLACS to change to use `get_unit_conversion_class`.

To avoid every subprocess of BLACS importing every unit conversion class (adds a lot to startup time), we'll just continue separating out BLACS tabs from labscript classes in labscript_devices, so that BLACS tabs and workers can be imported without importing labscript.
content.html:
I'll leave labscript importing * for the moment, it imports lots of time consuming things anyway like pylab, so removing the unit conversions import would only be a modest speed improvement. Maybe will break this in labscript 3.

I'll merge this, which paves the way for labscript to save fully qualified unit conversion path names, and BLACS to change to use get_unit_conversion_class.

To avoid every subprocess of BLACS importing every unit conversion class (adds a lot to startup time), we'll just continue separating out BLACS tabs from labscript classes in labscript_devices, so that BLACS tabs and workers can be imported without importing labscript.
